{include "default_salutation"} –

We've written before about HB 244, the bill that would restart executions in Montana. Thanks to your advocacy, we had nearly enough votes, but unfortunately, it just passed out of the Senate Judiciary Committee. The entire Senate will vote on this bill shortly – we have one last chance to stop it from passing!

Can you ask this target list of Senators to vote 'no' on HB 244?

Take Action

This bill would resume executions by eliminating any requirement for fast-acting drugs, making executions less humane and more expensive.

The bill is too broad, too ambiguous, and does nothing to prevent cruel and inhumane executions. This bill would make the death penalty more cruel and longer, and its complete lack of restrictions would guarantee a years-long lawsuit at taxpayers' expense.

Regardless of your stance on the death penalty, HB 244 is the wrong path for Montana. Scrambling for new modes for the state to kill people won't make our state safer or more just.

Thanks for taking action, again. I know we're asking a lot this session, but we truly believe that your engagement makes a difference.
